Posts.Content: Feb 3, 2018 08:32AM queen_k0302 wrote: Sorry, it has taken me forever to respond. My pulminologist and oncologist suggested we retest in 6 months before a diagnosis is given. The CT scan picked up my uterus enlargement. My oncologist sent me to an gynecologist oncologist. My uterus is 9.6 cm larger than average and the endometrial lining uneven. Inside there was very tiny free space. So, I had a D&C hysteroscopy with byopsy and uterine ablation. I get those results on February 13th.
Posts.Title: Possible mets to lung after treatment queen_k0302 Alicethecat2

Posts.Content: queen_k0302 wrote: I went through chemo, radiation, lumpectomy and double mastectomy for er+pr-her2+ stage 2a gade 3 IDC. I finished all treatments in march 2017. May I was admitted to the hospital for a partially collapsed lung. On the x-ray they saw 2 tiny spots. The pulminologist recommended another x-ray 6 months later. After that x-ray, he said their are some changes. I'm going in on the 28th (tomorrow ) for a ct. Has anyone had lung mets spread via bloodstream? I'm so nervous and scared. Dx March 27 2a er+pr- her2+ chemo lumpectomy radiation Dx 3/27/2016, IDC, Right, 4cm, Stage IIA, Grade 3, 0/3 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2+ (FISH) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Possible mets to lung after treatment queen_k0302 Alicethecat2

Posts.Content: Apr 10, 2017 06:59PM queen_k0302 wrote: Hello everyone! I'm Kara. I was diagnosed with stage 2a, grade 3, er+pr- her2+, 0 genetics (extinsive genetic testing) IDC on March 20, 2016. I had just turned 31 a month before. I am now 32 with a soon to be 15 yr old, 9 and 5 yr old. I did 8 rounds of tch with 4 weeks of taxotere. (I only have 2 more herceptin treatments left.) Lumpectomy in Sept and 33 rounds of radiation. I finished Dec 4th. The hardest part for me, was going through this without my mom. My mother in law, best friend, cousin, children and husband stood next to me during this journey. Now I'm trying to find my new normal. You ladies will get through this like another journey to concur.
Posts.Title: Enjoying your 30s...and breast cancer! Jsut9802 Ella77
